newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY'S APV DECLARES RINGA TENDER UNSUCCESSFUL.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY'S APV DECLARES RINGA TENDER UNSUCCESSFUL.

text.p: Hungary's state privatisation agency APV Rt declared two tenders for the privatisation of a total 85 percent stake in meat processor ~Ringa Husipari Rt~ unsuccessful, APV said in a statement.

"The board...decided to declare the tenders for both a 34 percent stake and for an 51 percent stake as well unsuccessful on grounds of production, cooperational, operational, technological and market interests," APV said.
It added it would call a new tender for the 85 percent stake in Ringa, to be offered to strategic investors and agricultural producers, or consortiums of those.

APV earlier offered a 51 percent stake, worth a nominal 420.7 million forints and Ringa's liabilities of 1.2 billion forints towards APV to investors, and also offered a 34 percent stake, worth a nominal 280 million, to suppliers for compensation coupons .
Earlier this week meat processor Pick Szeged denied press information that it had won the tender.
On the Budapest Stock Exchange Pick shares finished at 14,600 forints.
